Texts:
Today was incredibly hot. The temperature soared, and it felt like the sun was relentless, pouring its heat onto everything in sight. The moment I stepped outside, I could feel the warmth wrapping around me like a thick, suffocating blanket.

In the morning, I tried to stay indoors as much as possible. The fan was on full blast, but it barely made a difference. I even considered getting an air conditioner, something I've always avoided due to the cost and energy consumption. By noon, the heat had become almost unbearable. I could see waves of heat rising from the pavement, making everything look wavy and distorted.
